Articles.Content: <figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"><img src="http://41.media.tumblr.com/5e37da3aa64def9f6fc5287dd24e070a/tumblr_inline_nvxd8dy8gl1rr2wit_540.jpg" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"/></figure><figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="1441" data-orig-width="933"><img src="http://41.media.tumblr.com/d3c34c857098d97b1fc01b6ec80dd508/tumblr_inline_nvxd8mQydb1rr2wit_540.jpg" data-orig-height="1441" data-orig-width="933"/></figure><p>With all the excitement of The Martian.TheKingOfBeat .created this amazing image of <a href="http://imgur.com/C3LgUw6">Jebediah Kerman at The Dunian! </a>.#BringHimHome #KSP <br/><br/></p>

Very cool.

The movie was really good. Probably gonna see it again.
I once left Jeb out on Duna for 48 kerbal-years. I think he can survive that long.

Very cool.

The movie was really good. Probably gonna see it again.

Meh, the movie never really managed any dramatic tension. All it really had going for it were the jokes, references, & the soundtrack. It's more of a "fun to watch once" kinda movie than a "must watch over and over again" movie.

Still, great job with the poster. It looks awesome.

Meh, the movie never really managed any dramatic tension. All it really had going for it were the jokes, references, & the soundtrack. It's more of a "fun to watch once" kinda movie than a "must watch over and over again" movie.

Still, great job with the poster. It looks awesome.

I agree. It's not like it was a bad movie or anything, but (and I can't believe I'm saying this) the book is better than the movie. It generates much more tension and is the first book that made me shake, sweat and keep reading for an entire night.

But on topic, I wish I had those art skills! I like to think I can draw, but when I try to prove that fact to myself I always end up breaking a pencil near the start of a "masterpiece" and never bothering to finish it. xD
Fantastic poster! I attempted recreating the Hermes, but oh the lag...
Book was great, film was just as good, I knew it was only a matter of time before it was Kerbalized. Great work!
Huh? Didn't anybody notice this fanwork which is also a Bring Him Home poster?
Forgive me, but would it not be 'The Dunan'?
